definition: incessant playing of instruments and reciting of poems (idiom)

sentences.english: From which I will learn often and work hard.
sentences.chinese: 我会勤以致学，工作不辍。

sentences.english: He trains every day with his passion.
sentences.chinese: 每天临池不辍，激情不衰。

sentences.english: Latterly based in Monte Carlo Newton went on working to the end.
sentences.chinese: 后来居住在蒙特卡罗的牛顿一直工作不辍。

sentences.english: Though over 70, the famous writer had still been active;
sentences.chinese: 这位名作家尽管年逾70，仍然笔耕不辍。

sentences.english: Frost Crack hands bleeding, still insists chuo.
sentences.chinese: 双手冻裂出血，仍坚持不辍。

sentences.english: In the busy work, Zhu Dong E Lianbi still stopped working, it is not easy.
sentences.chinese: 在繁忙的工作之余，朱东锷仍不辍练笔，实属不易。

sentences.english: Learning a language needs a lot of practice.
sentences.chinese: 学习语言需要勤练不辍。

sentences.english: Eight years' intensive and pioneering effort brings GYU an abundant harvest.
sentences.chinese: 八年艰苦创业不辍耕耘，几年的奋斗拼搏硕果累累。

sentences.english: Through years of constant effort, he finally became skilled in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 经过寒暑不辍的努力，他终于练就了一手的好字。

sentences.english: For the next year Jo continued to write these stories and earn money.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的一年，乔写作不辍，赚取稿费。

definition: to make a living by writing/to write (as an author)
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
to pore over a book/to look and admire
